2811 is considering returning our Swerve X so I‚Äôm making a drivetrain form so we know what the meta is for when we choose what swerve to go for. The form includes options for all drivetrain types so please fill it out even if your team doesn‚Äôt use swerve.

This needs SO MUCH MORE context.

posts.name: Michael Havrylyuk
posts.cooked: We have Swerve X on a test frame and we are considering returning the modules we bought that are not put together because there isn‚Äôt much adoption for Swerve X. This form is meant to give us a feel for what modules teams use as well as gear ratio correlation to robot weight.

posts.name: ridge478
posts.cooked: We have been using WCP Swerve for a couple of years and we are using the Swerve X inverted this year. All modules have been bullet proof through many competitions. We are very happy with them and the support from WCP.
This isn‚Äôt how you should be making drivetrain decisions in my opinion. Is the only reason you aren‚Äôt using your swerve X is because most people aren‚Äôt using them?

posts.name: Sam R
posts.cooked: We have been running Swerve X the last two years and are very happy with the modules. They took multiple falls from between the mid and high bars last year and there was zero issue with the module or the wheels.

posts.name: Matt Golman
posts.cooked:
A few concerns:

Swerve X modules are very well made, and high performing. Don‚Äôt return them just because SDS has bigger market share. If you have specific problems with their performance or reliability that aren‚Äôt shared by the other options, then you could consider returning them and picking up something else.

Swerve X modules are very well made, and high performing. Don‚Äôt return them just because SDS has bigger market share. If you have specific problems with their performance or reliability that aren‚Äôt shared by the other options, then you could consider returning them and picking up something else.

ChiefDelphi is not a representative sample of FRC teams. Any data you get from this survey will be biased.

ChiefDelphi is not a representative sample of FRC teams. Any data you get from this survey will be biased.

WCP doesn‚Äôt accept returns for used items. If you‚Äôve used them, you‚Äôre out of luck on the return.

WCP doesn‚Äôt accept returns for used items. If you‚Äôve used them, you‚Äôre out of luck on the return.

Pedantic correction on the survey - MK4 is not a ‚Äúprevious revision‚Äù to the MK4i, they‚Äôre the same module with the motors flipped.

Pedantic correction on the survey - MK4 is not a ‚Äúprevious revision‚Äù to the MK4i, they‚Äôre the same module with the motors flipped.

posts.name: Michael Havrylyuk
posts.cooked: by previous revisions i meant Mk3 and Mk2

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Okay. Ours is super weird and I did my best to explain how it works but we do not fit into the options the way they are laid out.

Summary: We use 4 falcons for x drive with 16:1 sport planetary gearboxes. Then we have a toggle traction drive that‚Äôs driven with 2 NEOs into the standard Rev Drivetrain gearbox with a 12:1(not shown in the below pic)

Notes: We know the falcon has slightly higher rpm so not matching ratios is okay. We also match RPM of the output. We use pneumatics to lift the traction arms up and down. So we use both NEOs and falcons due to what we had in house and the super long falcon delays from fall-january. This system was designed to give us better defensive power and control over the normal X drive and to make auton and endgame simpler. This is like having a cantilevered tank drive when you want it with 8 motors or having a standard 4 motor x drive the rest of the time for ease of maneuverability. This is the first time we have combined traction in but we have used this style of X drive for 3 years now. The reason for the addition of traction is we got pushed around too much otherwise. We got passed up multiple years for just not having enough pushing power and not being a top level offensive team. So we landed here with this‚Ä¶ Umm‚Ä¶ unique Drivetrain. So I hope it doesn‚Äôt mess up your data too much!

20230318_190310 1920√ó1440 252 KB

20230318_190310 1920√ó1440 252 KB

20230318_190310 1920√ó1440 252 KB

For the head scratchers this might help https://www.reddit.com/r/FRC/comments/1149o5t/only_3_weeks_to_go_til_our_first_comp_well_be/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=android_app&utm_name=androidcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button
